title: Why do people fight in groups? - Quora

response.answer_text: Some people might tell you this is because it is a “safety in numbers” thing where you know someone has your back and you have theirs. Some might tell you this is because the people in the group feel they have the greater chance of dominating their adversary. Others still might tell you this is because the singular person doesn’t feel they have the skills to handle opponents on their own and require the backup and emotional support from others to give them the courage to continue or even begin to confront an adversary. The truth is, they are ALL correct; depending on the situation and the person who is about to get into that fight. Some people only have the will to fight back when someone else is around them; either to protect or to impress that other person depends on the individual. Many people have not been taught environmental and situational awareness and require someone at their back and sides in order to be able to focus on the task in front of them. Still others don’t have the confidence to handle an aggressive situation on their own and require someone else they trust near them to support them emotionally or push them along when they falter. Either way, the single martial artist should learn how to comfortably handle individual and multiple targets… er….. opponents up to six (6) people. Why six (6)? Because that is the maximum number of people who can surround you comfortably on all sides and still attack you without getting in each other’s way. After that, it only matters how many people their are because of the amount of stamina and endurance the practitioner has. I hope that helps.

As in a Group versus one person? Well, if the “leader” or “most dangerous” goes in alone and get whooped… well… there goes that person. So, instead of that happening, they increase the odds of winning. You see, this isn’t very brave. More tactical. But, usually bullies do this, unless they are much bigger than their victim.
